recommendations.title: Life in Early Cities: On Neighborhoods and Energized Crowding
recommendations.excerpt: To understand why early cities thrived, look not to the temples of kings but to their subjects’ bustling neighborhoods

recommendations.title: How To Do Lying Leg Raises To Seriously Tone Your Lower Abs
recommendations.excerpt: One abs exercise. So many benefits.

recommendations.title: A stranger on an airplane gave her $100 years ago and changed her life. Now she's trying to find the mystery woman to thank her
recommendations.excerpt: Ayda Zugay was fleeing the former Yugoslavia with her older sister when a stranger handed them an envelope after meeting them on a plane. They were shocked to find $100 inside. For years she's been trying to find the mystery woman and thank her.

recommendations.title: What Did Medieval Peasants Know?
recommendations.excerpt: The internet has become strangely nostalgic for life in the Middle Ages.

recommendations.title: Inside the Growing Discontent Behind Nintendo’s Fun Facade
recommendations.excerpt: In a special investigation, IGN dives deep into the current culture at Nintendo of America, where many employees are increasingly frustrated by treatment of contractors and lack of support amid growing demand.

recommendations.title: How 81-1 shot Rich Strike won the Kentucky Derby
recommendations.excerpt: Rich Strike, front right, with Sonny Leon aboard, wins the 148th running of the Kentucky Derby horse race at Churchill Downs Saturday, May 7, 2022, in Louisville, Ky. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) 1 of 10 Rich Strike, front right, with Sonny Leon aboard, wins the 148th running of the Kentucky Derby horse race at Churchill Downs Saturday, May 7, 2022, in Louisville, Ky. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson)  This doesn’t happen. Horses at odds of nearly 81-1 don’t win the Kentucky Derby.

recommendations.title: The War in Ukraine, as Seen on Russian TV
recommendations.excerpt: To Western audiences, Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has unfolded as a series of brutal attacks punctuated by strategic blunders. But on Russian television, those same events were spun as positive developments, an interpretation aided by a rapid jumble of opinion and falsehoods.

recommendations.title: Mathematicians Have Solved Traffic Jams, and They’re Begging Cities to Listen
recommendations.excerpt: Mathematicians are unimpressed by engineers’ solutions.

recommendations.title: Mine e-waste, not the Earth, say scientists
recommendations.excerpt: The recycling of e-waste must urgently be ramped up because mining the Earth for precious metals to make new gadgets is unsustainable, scientists say.

recommendations.title: 13 Delicious Sandwich Recipes
recommendations.excerpt: Make lunch the most exciting time of the day with a baker's dozen of mouthwatering sandwich recipes, from muffulettas to cubanos to MLTs (and BLTs, too).

recommendations.title: The secret world beneath our feet is mind-blowing – and the key to our planet’s future
recommendations.excerpt: Don’t dismiss soil: its unknowable wonders could ensure the survival of our species.

recommendations.title: The 3 Minutes It Takes To Read This Will Improve Your Conversations Forever
recommendations.excerpt: How to ask better questions.

recommendations.title: The Untold Story of the White House’s Weirdly Hip Record Collection
recommendations.excerpt: Jimmy Carter’s grandson is unlocking its mysteries.

recommendations.title: These Habits Are Making You More Irritable
recommendations.excerpt: If you're feeling extra peevish, these common behaviors may be at fault.

recommendations.title: 8 Ways Aloe Vera Gel Can Benefit Your Skin, According to Dermatologists
recommendations.excerpt: This natural plant can fight acne, prevent dark spots, and even slow down the signs of aging.

recommendations.title: Fast, Cheap, and Out of Control: Inside Shein’s Sudden Rise
recommendations.excerpt: The Chinese company has become a fast-fashion juggernaut by appealing to budget-conscious Gen Zers. But its ultralow prices are hiding unacceptable costs.

recommendations.title: ‘Ten Years Ago This Was Science Fiction’: The Rise of Weedkilling Robots
recommendations.excerpt: The makers of robot weeders say the machines can reduce pesticide use and be part of a more sustainable food system

recommendations.title: Think of a Number. How Do Math Magicians Know What It Is?
recommendations.excerpt: Mathematical magic can seem like mind reading. Your job is to reveal the secret behind these four tricks.

recommendations.title: We are the only humans in the universe
recommendations.excerpt: The Universe is so huge, and the worlds within it so numerous, that it seems like anything is possible. But the laws of physics and chemistry are the same everywhere.

recommendations.title: Television Is in a Showrunning Crisis
recommendations.excerpt: More and different kinds of people can now aspire to TV’s most important job—but streaming and COVID have set them up to fail.
